name: MediaGauge – Realtime Streaming Media Analytics
author: Epic Playground, Inc.

sections.description: MediaGauge’s WordPress plugin works by including a javascript library that checks each page’s HTML for video and audio players and then listens for user events like “play”, “pause”, “finish”, and “fullscreen”. These events are sent to MediaGauge’s API where they are recorded for later analysis. You can then login to MediaGauge.com and see realtime and historical charts that allow you to better understand how your visitors are engaging with your media.
sections.installation:
1. Upload /mediagauge-analytics to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Check that your domain is set correctly in the MediaGauge Analytics settings.
  4. Create an account with MediaGauge and login to view your analytics dashboard.

short_description: Realtime streaming media analytics. This plugin will detect most YouTube, Vimeo, and HTML5 videos.
description: MediaGauge’s WordPress plugin works by including a javascript library that checks each page’s HTML for video and audio players and then listens for user events like “play”, “pause”, “finish”, and “fullscreen”. You can then login to MediaGauge.com and see realtime and historical charts that allow you to better understand how your visitors are engaging with your media.
